meanings.definition: The regular rise and fall of the sea caused by the gravitational pull of the moon and sun.
meanings.sent1: The tide came in slowly, covering the sandy beach.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen know the best time to catch fish is when the tide is high.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was almost ruined when the tide unexpectedly washed away the sandwiches.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter ebbed and flowed like the tide, infectious and unstoppable.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the tide crashing against the rocks lulled her to sleep.

meanings.definition: A current or tendency of events or opinions.
meanings.sent1: There seems to be a tide of change sweeping through the company.
meanings.sent2: The political tide shifted in favor of the opposition party.
meanings.sent3: The tide of fashion turned, making bell-bottoms trendy again.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a tide of emotion, carrying the audience along with him.
meanings.sent5: The tide of support for the new policy was overwhelming.

meanings.sent1: She waited for the right tide to start her new job.
meanings.sent2: The tide of winter seemed to last forever.
meanings.sent3: The tide of the meeting dragged on, making everyone restless.
meanings.sent4: As the tide of the year turned, she reflected on her accomplishments.
meanings.sent5: The tide of history will remember those who fought for freedom.
